meanings.definition: A person who turns a crank.
meanings.sent1: The cranker at the factory worked tirelessly all day.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic is the cranker who fixes the engine with a turn of a handle.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pretended to be a cranker, spinning an imaginary wheel on his toy car.
meanings.sent4: She was the cranker of the group, always the one to initiate fun activities.
meanings.sent5: The cranker's job is crucial in making the machine operate smoothly.

meanings.definition: A machine or device that is used to turn a crank.
meanings.sent1: The old engine had a rusty cranker that needed replacement.
meanings.sent2: The antique car's cranker was essential for starting the vehicle.
meanings.sent3: The cranker on the fishing reel got stuck, causing a funny situation.
meanings.sent4: The cranker on the music box played a sweet melody when turned.
meanings.sent5: The cranker on the well was used to draw water up from the depths.

meanings.definition: To turn a crank forcefully or vigorously.
meanings.sent1: He had to cranker the lever to open the stubborn door.
meanings.sent2: She crankered the handle of the jack to lift the heavy car.
meanings.sent3: The children crankered the merry-go-round so fast they all got dizzy.
meanings.sent4: The old man crankered the music box, filling the room with nostalgic tunes.
meanings.sent5: The worker had to cranker the machine to get it running smoothly again.
